x_symbol.description: Enable dragging for the element. Optionally, dragging can be limited to a rectangular area. If fnDrag is not provided then this code will provide basic dragging. If fnDrag is provided then it must implement the dragging. See xEnableDrag for more info.
x_symbol.syntax: xDragInFence(ele[, fnDragStart[, fnDrag[, fnDragEnd[, x1, y1, x2, y2]]]])

par.name: ele
par.note: id string or element object reference.

par.name: fnDragStart
par.note: Function - will be called on mousedown on ele. fnDragStart(ele, mouseX, mouseY, xEventObj)

par.name: fnDrag
par.note: Function - will be called on each mousemove during dragging. fnDrag(ele, mouseDX, mouseDY, bWithinRect, xEventObj)

par.name: fnDragEnd
par.note: Function - will be called on mouseup on ele. fnDragEnd(ele, mouseX, mouseY, xEventObj)

par.name: x1, y1
par.note: Integers - the absolute position of the upper left corner of a rectangle to which dragging will be limited.

par.name: x2, y2
par.note: Integers - the absolute position of the lower right corner of a rectangle to which dragging will be limited.

par.name: limits element
par.note: id string or element reference - Instead of passing the 4 coordinates just pass an element id or ref in place of x1. The drag limits will adjust to the current size of the limits element.

demo.note: A test page for xDragInFence and xEnableDrop.

rev.author: mf
rev.note: Initial release. This function is backwards compatible with rev 6 of xEnableDrag.
